page.title: 17Smarden West - River Beult
page.content: The river Beult rises near Ashford and flows west through Smarden to enter the Medway at Yalding. 3 bridges cross the river in the area. Hadman's Bridge, now bypassed by a wider road, is a fine example of local design. The river supports various species of fish and wildfowl and abounds with water lilies. Dam boards are set in place in spring to hold back the water and so keep stock from straying but are removed in winter to prevent flooding. However, after heavy rain many low lying fields and roads are often under water. A flood warning system is operated to warn householders of rising water. The river carries water draining into it from many ditches.
